document.masterDocTitle: First records of the order Siphonophorida from Madagascar and Mauritius (Diplopoda)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First records of the order Siphonophorida from Madagascar and Mauritius (Diplopoda)

bibRefCitation.author: NEWPORT, G.
bibRefCitation.refString: NEWPORT, G. 1844. Conclusion of the monograph on the Myriapoda. Proceedings of the Linnean Society 1: 191 - 196.

subSubSection.paragraph: Siphonophorida characterized by a head extended into a sharply acuminate ‘beak’ or rostrum, lower half of it formed by gnathochilarium. Head with four macrosetae. Antennae straight, not elbowed, antennomeres 5 and 6 with large, conspicuous pit containing numerous sensory cones ( Hoffman, 1982 ). Antennomere 2 of normal length. 104 species in ten genera distributed in America, SE Asia and the Indian subcontinent (including N Pakistan ), Australia and New Zealand ( Jeekel, 2001 ).

MATERIAL EXAMINED: FMNH-INS 3978; 1 ♀ ;

, Winkler extraction. Remarks: Colouration marbled greyish, body short and densely pilose. – FMNH-INS 4089; 1 Ƌ
;
Madagascar , Province Antsiranana , Befingotra ( 9.2 km WSW), Rés. Anjanaharibe-Sud, 14.7500°S , 49.4667°E ,
1280 m
, montane rainforest; coll. B. L. Fisher ,
05.xi.1994
, Winkler extraction. Remarks : Colour similar to FMNH- INS 3978
.
SPECIMENS FROM MADAGASCAR ONLY DETERMINED TO ORDER LEVEL
The following specimens were regretfully only sorted to order level. A re-examination of the listed specimens was not possible during the course of this study.

Siphonorhinus sp.
, MHNG Mad 89/21, two males , A = smaller male specimen, B-D = largest male specimen, multi-layer photograph and SEM. (A) Habitus, lateral view. (B) First and second legs, anterior view. (C) Head, lateral view. (D) Posterior gonopods and leg pair 10, anterior view. Abbreviations: L1 = leg 1; L2 = leg 2; L10 = leg 10; pG = posterior gonopod (= leg 9); St = sternite fused to stigmatic plate.
